org.tikv.txn

Class LockResolverClientV3

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.tikv.common.AbstractGRPCClient<TikvGrpc.TikvBlockingStub,TikvGrpc.TikvFutureStub>
      • org.tikv.common.region.AbstractRegionStoreClient
        • org.tikv.txn.LockResolverClientV3
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AutoCloseable, RegionErrorReceiver, AbstractLockResolverClient

    public class LockResolverClientV3
extends AbstractRegionStoreClient
implements AbstractLockResolverClient
    Since v3.0.5 TiDB ignores the ttl on secondary lock and will use the ttl on primary key.

    • Method Detail

      • getVersion

        public String getVersion()

      • resolveLocks

        public ResolveLockResult resolveLocks(BackOffer bo,
                                      long callerStartTS,
                                      List<Lock> locks,
                                      boolean forWrite)
        Description copied from interface: AbstractLockResolverClient
        ResolveLocks tries to resolve Locks. The resolving process is in 3 steps: 1) Use the `lockTTL` to pick up all expired locks. Only locks that are old enough are considered orphan locks and will be handled later. If all locks are expired then all locks will be resolved so true will be returned, otherwise caller should sleep a while before retry. 2) For each lock, query the primary key to get txn(which left the lock)'s commit status. 3) Send `ResolveLock` cmd to the lock's region to resolve all locks belong to the same transaction.
        Specified by:
        resolveLocks in interface AbstractLockResolverClient
        Returns:
        msBeforeTxnExpired: 0 means all locks are resolved
